Rows are represented as objects, references become attributes of those objects which can be eager-loaded by a join when you fetch the parent object or lazy-loaded with their own query when they are actually accessed. The N+1 problem comes from this lazy-loading scenario.This programming model abstracts away the SQL which can be really cool and easy until you try to do something off the beaten path.
